title: How to Dry Jeans Quickly with an Iron

steps.headline: Wring out any extra water.
steps.description: This method only works if the jeans aren't soaking wet.

steps.headline: Take a towel, fold it so that it will fit into the leg of your jeans and place it in the leg.
Turn your iron on the highest heat setting suitable for the jeans.
Hold and move the iron around a lot.
steps.description: Keep pressing until your jeans brighten up to their normal color.

steps.headline: Repeat on the other leg.
steps.description: Continue until the jeans are dry enough to wear; any residual dampness will dry off during wearing, provided it's a warm enough day.

text: Take jeans out of washer.  Wring out any extra water. This method only works if the jeans aren't soaking wet. Take a towel, fold it so that it will fit into the leg of your jeans and place it in the leg.  Turn your iron on the highest heat setting suitable for the jeans. Start to iron. Hold and move the iron around a lot. Keep pressing until your jeans brighten up to their normal color. Repeat on the other leg. Continue until the jeans are dry enough to wear; any residual dampness will dry off during wearing, provided it's a warm enough day.
sentences: This method only works if the jeans aren't soaking wet.
Take a towel, fold it so that it will fit into the leg of your jeans and place it in the leg.
Turn your iron on the highest heat setting suitable for the jeans.
Hold and move the iron around a lot.
Keep pressing until your jeans brighten up to their normal color.
Continue until the jeans are dry enough to wear; any residual dampness will dry off during wearing, provided it's a warm enough day.
